to_label: Import the necessary libraries. We need numpy for creating arrays, pandas for data manipulation (though it's not used directly in this problem), and matplotlib for plotting.

from_label: Import the necessary libraries. We need numpy for creating arrays, pandas for data manipulation (though it's not used directly in this problem), and matplotlib for plotting.
to_label: Create the data for plotting. Use numpy's arange function to create arrays for x and y. Here, both x and y are created with the same range of values from 0 to 9.

from_label: Create the data for plotting. Use numpy's arange function to create arrays for x and y. Here, both x and y are created with the same range of values from 0 to 9.
to_label: Use matplotlib to plot the graph. The plt.plot(y, x) function is used to plot y against x.

from_label: Use matplotlib to plot the graph. The plt.plot(y, x) function is used to plot y against x.
to_label: Set the title of the plot. Use plt.title() to set the title, and include the Greek letter phi formatted in bold. The title uses LaTeX formatting with the r"$...$" syntax to render the phi character, and \mathbf for making it bold.

from_label: Set the title of the plot. Use plt.title() to set the title, and include the Greek letter phi formatted in bold. The title uses LaTeX formatting with the r"$...$" syntax to render the phi character, and \mathbf for making it bold.
to_label: Display the plot using plt.show(). This step actually renders the plot so it can be viewed.
